title: Multiboot from SATA HDD not USB

forumNotes.author: Karl Fiabeschi
forumNotes.content:
Hi guys,  

i want to creat a multiboot (acronis, clonezilla and other utils) in a HDD Sata drive.. to plug and unplug in PC for work. (not usb)  

I try to do it with sardu but dosen't work.. any suggest?  

sorry 4 my bad english

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Try Easy2Boot.

Use RMPrepUSB to prepare the hard disk and be sure to tick the Setttings - List Hard Disks.

[http://www.easy2boot...sing-rmprepusb/](http://www.easy2boot.com/make-an-easy2boot-usb-drive/make-and-e2b-usb-drive-using-rmprepusb/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Must be something wrong with the hard disk or the system BIOS you are testing with. Copying files does not normally make a drive unbootable.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: OK, but bear in mind that Easy2Boot is designed to work as an external USB drive, so some things might not work - e.g. installing an OS, etc. because the SATA E2B drive will be 'seen' by the installer as boot drive and therefore you may get boot code installed onto the E2B drive if you try to run installer ISOs, etc!

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Probably your E2B drive won't boot now either.

To fix the E2B drive - use RMPrepUSB and click on Install grub4dos to MBR

To fix the win 7 OS, boot from a Win 7 DVD or USb E2B drive and Repair (or run bcdboot).
